messages.message:
Hey @Heymian - I wanted to follow up on this.  Is there a way to "edit" or resolve users?  I am encountering a lot of folks who land in purgatory (no token, admin didnt create the account).  Unless I am missing something, if they create an account themselves, users are pretty much permanently stuck.

Can we disable the standard "create account" button on the landing page?  I dont entirely understand when you would actually want to use that...  Or can we provide admins some control to approve users / change emails / resolve issues?

Typical Scenario:
I have a sandbox for enablement, we get some user who was unexpected in the session.  I have not created an account for that user via admin, and they do not use the token.  In this scenario that user has burnt their username and email address.

I created this ticket, but im not sure if i filed it correctly. https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/CS-2367
They can unlock themselves by using the token when they login. They can use the token either when they create the account or upon login.

I'm embarrassed to admit, I just learned that we need to change the token URL.  Its super non-intuitive.

That being said, this unblocks me for the moment!  Can we provide users a link to the login url with a token, or otherwise help them get unstuck?

Also, when would we ever want to use the account creation without the token?  Could we just disable that?

Thanks.
Yup. you can definitely share the token login URL, did you find it? can append ?use_token=true to the login URL

For customer’s deployed on-prem where their environment is gated, tokens and email verification is disabled because their user account creation is either protected by SAML or they are happy to allow anyone at the bank/company to create an account.

This gating is enabled for our environments to prevent anyone in the world from creating accounts.
URLs can be found here for reference https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IT/pages/956465261/How+to+create+an+Instabase.com+account

I guess it seems like there is no use for the non-token account creation.  It'd be better if that said "join waitlist" or something. Or even better, just have the account creation link go straight to the token screen.  AFAIK, nobody every actually _wants to be on a waitlist_

yeah it’s mostly to block bots and unwanted external users, E.g. on dogfood some scanner bot created a few thousand accounts a couple months ago and didn’t get access to anything. And on prod we purged all external accounts recently. We don’t actually want folks using our platform unless we explicitly grant it.
If we get sandboxes behind VPN this likely can also go away and we can disable these security measures for them.
